In this class we will dive into your personality and the individuality of each of your children. You will learn the language of the 4 temperaments. You will come to understand why your children can trigger less than desirable responses in you and how you can work through those triggers to not only better understand yourself, but know how to approach different interactions with your children more effectively.

This class is taught by Tara Carlson & Liz Macdonald on Thursday evenings from 6:00 p.m. - 8:00 p.m. (February 20, 27, March 5, 19). The cost is $175 for the course (this includes the workbook), and $125 for a spouse/partner to attend. To register, go to: http://www.wasatchfamilyfoundation.org/parenting-classes.html

Cover letters and/or resumes should highlight skills and experience in the areas of community sponsorships, in-kind donations, event planning, and grant writing. Who is Jack Petrash? I why is it such a BIG deal that he will be speaking at the Wasatch Waldorf Charter School spring fundraising event? Well, Jack is a master Waldorf teacher with over 30 years of classroom experience. He is also an author, father, and one of the best spokespersons for Waldorf education.
How do we educate children in a rapidly changing world and prepare them for a future that we can’t yet envision?
Jack attempts to answer this question in an inspiring TEDxTalk, https://youtu.be/imaW-TabxOE, "Educating Children for the Journey.
It's not too late to come hear Jack and support an amazing school and our children. To purchase tickets go here; https://secureinstantpayments.com/sip/cart/event.php?EID=2519

BOOKS BY JACK PETRASH:
Understanding Waldorf Education: Teaching from the Inside Out
Navigating the Terrain of Childhood: A Guidebook for Meaningful Parenting and Heartfelt Discipline
Covering Home: Lessons on the Art of Fathering from the Game of Baseball

Wasatch Waldorf Charter School is preparing for its first annual Spring Gala and Auction. The event is scheduled for Friday, March 3. Tickets will go on sale soon.

The school is in its first year and is raising funds for so many projects; like the music program, woodworking program, playground equipment, etc. We are looking for donations of goods or services. We can also use LOTS of volunteer help if anyone wants to help. If you are to provide a donation and/or volunteer, please contact the auction coordinator, Emily Potts, ebpotts@yahoo.com
We can make arrangements to pick up donations. We will also provide a donation receipt, the school is a 501(c)3 nonprofit.
We need to have donations in-hand by mid-February.

Thank you!
